content.description: This is a fun and inviting hand crack/offwidth. Start low.
content.location: It is 0.3 miles past paved road on Hwy 97. You must cross a river which is easy to do at low water.

climbs.name: Moonridge Crack
climbs.fa: rumors of Boulderites, but otherwise Baker, 1972

content.description:
The 5.10 overhanging crack splitting Moonridge Boulder is conveniently located on the margin of CO Highway 67. There is just enough room for a crash pad to be placed off the pavement. Moonridge Crack is rarely climbed, so slippery pine needles can build up on the upper slab, above the overhanging 5.10 Â crack, presenting a big fall hazard. By the way, spelling for Moonridge is based on local nomenclature.

It is located about 0.8 miles west of Rampart Range Road on CO Hwy 67. Going to Devil's Head, it is less than a mile out of the way to the Moonridge Crack.
content.protection: Tape for the hands, crack shoes, and crash pads. Baker used a broom to clean off the pine needles and gravel on the summit slab.
